Package view

Class Summary
BoardComponent The BoardComponent contains three layers: the board (bottom), the pieces (middle), and the special effects (top).
BoardLayer The BoardLayer is the bottommost layer in a BoardComponent.
CapturedComponent Class that displays the captured pieces and whether or not you are in check or anticheck.
EffectsLayer The EffectsLayer contains a lot of the brains of the GUI.
GView This is the Graphical View of antichess.
InfoComponent A helpful organizational factory class that returns a Component containing the NamePlate and CapturedComponent
LoadDialog LoadGameDialog is a set-up dialog for when the user wants to load a new game.
MainComponent A packaging of smaller classes and widgets.
MenuBar A Menu bar for the GUI.
MoveHistoryComponent The MoveHistoryComponent is a set of widgets that together comprise the view of the move history.
NamePlate A NamePlate displays the player's name and a TimeBar showing approximately how much time they have left.
NewGameDialog NewGameDialog is a set-up dialog for when the user wants to begin a new game.
PieceLayer This is a widget that displays only chess pieces.
PlayerSettingsDialog PlayerSettingsDialog is a set-up dialog for when the user wants to begin a new game.
TextUI A TextUI is an interactive text interface to play AntiChess.
TimeBar The Time Bar is a red bar that slows decreases proportionally to how much time a player has left on his clock.
TimerComponent A timer component is a widget that displays how much time a player has left before he runs out of time and loses the game.
